definitions: To refuse to answer a question on the grounds that the answer might incriminate oneself, invoking the Fifth Amendment to the U.S. Constitution.
examples: When asked about the missing documents, the witness chose to plead the fifth.
You have the right to plead the fifth if you believe your testimony could be used against you.
He was advised by his lawyer to plead the fifth during the interrogation.
pastTenses: pled the fifth, pleaded the fifth
